post.body:
Templatizer plugins should not depend on any libraries. Not even a runtime library.
The higher level language used on the plugin forbids pointers.
Structs, arrays and strings are incompatible and can't be passed as a function parameter so they must be filled element by element.
Getters and setters should be used to fill and retrieve elements from them one by one, character by character, element by element, field by field, machine word by machine word.
post.author: Mateus

post.body:
Or I could write just enough D to run Templatizer bytecode.
Templatizer should be something like Dartmouth BASIC: a series of complex instructions. Something like Assembly. It could support the 'label' instruction and the 'goto' instruction. The '@' symbol works like the read instruction. The plugin translates input from stdin (POST data) that could be in XML or JSON or, maybe, even binary data like XDR if run locally on the machine.
